page.title: 14THE HALL_HUSBANDS BOSWORTH
page.content: The oldest part of the house was built in 1540.Since then another part has been built in 1792,later a bay was added to the house in 1823.The old hall was built on Norman foundations. There are some cottages in the grounds where some of the servants used to live.The family that live there now have lived there for about 40 years but the actual family have lived there since 1661.The Turville family came over to Britain with William the Conquerer in 1066.The old house has been used for 2 things during wars.The first is the priest hole which is built under the old hall.It was used for hiding Roman Catholic priests during the Civil war.The other is in the 2nd world war there was an army camp in the grounds outside the hall. The house has about 300 acres of land altogether which gardeners look after.
